# The `LTO` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class implements a resolution-based interface to LLVM&#39;s <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> functionality. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::lto::LTO</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class implements a resolution-based interface to LLVM&#39;s <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> functionality.

It supports regular <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a>, parallel <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> code generation and ThinLTO. You can use it from a linker in the following way:
<ul>
<li>Set hooks and code generation options (see <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/config">lto::Config</a> struct defined in <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>), and use the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/config">lto::Config</a> object to create an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">lto::LTO</a> object.</li>
<li>Create <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/inputfile">lto::InputFile</a> objects using <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/inputfile/#a1aa10be5e2a432c4ca74d5f70c0cd77c">lto::InputFile::create()</a>, then use the symbols() function to enumerate its symbols and compute a resolution for each symbol (see <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/symbolresolution">SymbolResolution</a> below).</li>
<li>After the linker has visited each input file (and each regular object file) and computed a resolution for each symbol, take each <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/inputfile">lto::InputFile</a> and pass it and an array of symbol resolutions to the <a href="#a0c3e8ed752bc7ef92ccb9edbd4bb014a">add()</a> function.</li>
<li>Call the <a href="#ac0010e13022065d0cb4a16df7547a232">getMaxTasks()</a> function to get an upper bound on the number of native object files that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> may add to the link.</li>
<li>Call the <a href="#ada5eca1803d5afcb1005ea05ffc62636">run()</a> function. This function will use the supplied AddStream and Cache functions to add up to <a href="#ac0010e13022065d0cb4a16df7547a232">getMaxTasks()</a> native object files to the link.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 336 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h">LTO.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### LTO() {#a0a018a3788daddbb88cb4308d0a0e715}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LTO::LTO (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/config">Config</a> Conf, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/thinbackend">ThinBackend</a> Backend=&#123;&#125;, unsigned ParallelCodeGenParallelismLevel=1, <a href="#a543ba3f4e6777febf274a87ea5ac9bd7">LTOKind</a> LTOMode=<a href="#a543ba3f4e6777febf274a87ea5ac9bd7a7f9c9642d0db28894d5090e409170a51">LTOK&#95;Default</a>)</>}>
Create an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> object.

A default constructed <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> object has a reasonable production configuration, but you can customize it by passing arguments to this constructor. FIXME: We do currently require the DiagHandler field to be set in Conf. Until that is fixed, a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/config">Config</a> argument is required.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h/#l00357">357</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h">LTO.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp/#l00607">607</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp">LTO.cpp</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### add() {#a0c3e8ed752bc7ef92ccb9edbd4bb014a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error LTO::add (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/inputfile">InputFile</a> &gt; Obj, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/symbolresolution">SymbolResolution</a> &gt; Res)</>}>
Add an input file to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> link, using the provided symbol resolutions.

The symbol resolutions must appear in the enumeration order given by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/inputfile/#a4ff6ebe6ed80ef8ec41cc716216d05f4">InputFile::symbols()</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h/#l00365">365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h">LTO.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp/#l00728">728</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp">LTO.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getMaxTasks() {#ac0010e13022065d0cb4a16df7547a232}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned LTO::getMaxTasks () const">
Returns an upper bound on the number of tasks that the client may expect.

This may only be called after all IR object files have been added. For a full description of tasks see <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/ltobackend-h">LTOBackend.h</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h/#l00370">370</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h">LTO.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp/#l01110">1110</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp">LTO.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### run() {#ada5eca1803d5afcb1005ea05ffc62636}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error LTO::run (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aeb8b31be7b2c7dd67496051d7f952e94">AddStreamFn</a> AddStream, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/filecache">FileCache</a> Cache=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Runs the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> pipeline.

This function calls the supplied AddStream function to add native object files to the link.

The Cache parameter is optional. If supplied, it will be used to cache native object files and add them to the link.

The client will receive at most one callback (via either AddStream or Cache) for each task identifier.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h/#l00380">380</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/lto-h">LTO.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp/#l01161">1161</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/lto-cpp">LTO.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### addRegularLTO() {#ab8d6edfab9c561f9d0465f5f02fca1ce}
